title: SingleFile browser extension
body_html:
There is a existing Chrom Extension, SinglePage that will do most of the bundling work in the browser, live.

This would solve the session sharing problem and get us a huge kickstart.

The idea is to run it on page exit, so that it would store a page as you saw it.

However, this would basically rule out plugins (?) -- except post-process ones.

body:
There is a existing Chrom Extension, [SinglePage](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/singlefile/mpiodijhokgodhhofbcjdecpffjipkle?hl=en) that will do most of the bundling work in the browser, live.

This would solve the session sharing problem and get us a huge kickstart.

The idea is to run it on page exit, so that it would store a page as you saw it.

However, this would basically rule out plugins (?) -- except post-process ones.
